import { useState } from "react" const LogsComponent = (props) => { const userData = props.userData const refreshData = props.refreshData const [logsExpand, setLogsExpand] = useState(false) const expandLogs = () => { setLogsExpand(!logsExpand) console.log("This is the logsExpand function; ", logsExpand) } // what is displayed in the logs box switch (userData.serverPods.status) { case "True": return (
{userData.serverPods.logs}

Logs
) case "False": return

Shutting Down

case "Pending": return

Starting up

case "Queuing": return

Queuing for server

case "server not running": return (
) default: return

ERROR OCCURED

} } export default LogsComponent
